result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Lee Brisby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court ordered all other conditions be the same as ordered in Milwaukee County case 02CF2450 and Columbia County case 08CF228.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample ad pay DNA surcharge, unless previously submitted.
Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are ssupended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds and earning. Balance  during period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Lee Brisby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEAN AND SENTENCING commencing 8-31-15 received and filed. (31 Pages.)

Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Original Information not in the court file. Docket entry reflects the Information was filed at the Preliminary Hearing on 5/19/15. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the Information on the preliminary hearing date. State filed an additional copy of the Information and per the Court is file-stamped today's date. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in. 

As to COUNT 1- 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Willie Lee Brisby not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Deann Heard for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested another date; defendant is facing revocation.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be reassigned to the Honorable Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Case is continued before Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Willie Lee Brisby not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise that defendant is facing revocation; defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, Defendant Willie Lee Brisby not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Defense has yet to receive discovery or offer.  Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing May 19, 2014 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:
Darryl Smith (PD Staff)
819 N. 6th Street
Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Torres-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with TRAVIS S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Willie Lee Brisby in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
